title: Week in pictures: 29 August - 4 September 2020
description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

title: Galaxy Z Fold2: Samsung's third attempt at a folding smartphone
description: Will it be "third time lucky" for Samsung as it reveals its latest attempt at a folding smartphone?

title: Coronavirus: What lessons can rest of UK learn from Scotland's school return?
description: Scottish pupils returned to classes nearly three weeks sooner than elsewhere in the UK - so how has it gone?

title: Black Panther: The 'weird signs' that led Chadwick Boseman to Wakanda
description: When Marvel's first black male superhero was cast, Boseman revealed there had been "weird signs" that it might happen.

title: US protests: Dark-clad thugs on planes and other claims fact-checked
description: We've been debunking the misinformation swirling around protest movements in US cities.

title: US election 2020: Will Trump voters support the president again?
description: Voters in a historic steel town helped Trump win in 2016. We hear from one devoted fan and a couple who regret their choice.

title: The zookeeper having a giraffe with her tattoos
description: A Scottish zookeeper has honoured the animals she looks after by immortalising them in ink.

title: Coronavirus: Leeds becomes 'area of concern'
description: A rise in infection rates sees the city added to Public Heath England's coronavirus watchlist.

title: Car spotted crashing in waves on beach in St Agnes
description: The recovery driver who retrieved the car said it was full of seaweed and stones.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Jacqui Smith completes 2020 line-up
description: The former politician will join the likes of Bill Bailey, Clara Amfo, and HRVY on this year's show.

title: The surprising secret hidden in a pregnancy test
description: Researchers take apart a digital pregnancy testing kit and find a standard paper strip inside.

title: Southgate open to Maguire England return in October
description: England manager Gareth Southgate says he will be "absolutely be looking" to reintroduce Harry Maguire to the international fold in October.

title: Coronavirus: 'My mother wanted one last holiday'
description: Derek Burt says his family is trying to return from Portugal before Scotland's quarantine rules kick in.

title: 'People thought I was living a dream, I was dreading every second' - ex-Yorkshire bowler Rafiq
description: Azeem Rafiq says while people thought he was "living a dream" in reality he was "dreading every second" of his time at Yorkshire.

title: Coronavirus: Virgin Atlantic to cut 1,150 more jobs
description: The airline, which has just completed a rescue deal, says it has to make cuts in order to survive.

title: Coronavirus quarantine rules: Differences across UK 'confusing', Grant Shapps says
description: The transport secretary admits varying approaches to international travel restrictions are frustrating.

title: Brexit: UK 'sleepwalking into disaster' over border plans, hauliers warn
description: Haulage companies warn supply chains could be "severely disrupted" when the Brexit transition period ends.

title: Coronavirus case numbers 'remain unchanged' in England
description: Despite local outbreaks, household tests suggest the level of the virus was stable during August.

title: Suarez agrees deal with Juventus - Balague
description: Barcelona forward Luis Suarez agrees to join Juventus, reports BBC Radio 5 Live's Guillem Balague.

title: Hoo fire: 'Huge explosion' as fire rages at industrial unit
description: About 200 people are evacuated from the area and residents say they heard "two massive bangs".

title: Feargal Sharkey accuses Thames Water of sewage 'dumping'
description: Former Undertones front man Feargal Sharkey hit out at Thames Water on Twitter.

title: Don't miss out on black start-ups, investors told
description: Black Lives Matter has shone a spotlight on policing, but also on other areas, like the tech industry.

title: Jane Garvey to leave Woman's Hour
description: The BBC broadcaster is to get her own new Radio 4 show from 2021.

title: Mulan: Why Disney's latest reboot is facing boycott calls
description: Comments made by the film's star and Disney's supposed ties to China anger activists.

title: Co-op to create 1,000 jobs and open 50 new stores
description: Grocery chain the Co-op is opening 50 new stores and creating 1,000 new jobs this year

title: Brett Savage: 'Ministry of Defence failed our Army veteran son'
description: Brett Savage, who had served in Afghanistan, was found dead at his home in Newtownards, County Down.

title: Britney Spears appears to endorse the #FreeBritney movement
description: The pop star "welcomes and appreciates the informed support of her many fans", says her lawyer.

title: Court threat to housebuilders over leasehold ‘trap’
description: Four of the biggest UK developers are under the microscope over mis-selling concerns.

title: We get Louis Theroux’s take on #NoContextLouisTheroux
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat gets the documentary-maker's take on the online trend #NoContextLouisTheroux.

title: It will be tough to win another Grand Slam but I'll still aim for the stars - Murray
description: Three-time major champion Andy Murray says winning another Grand Slam will be "extremely difficult" but he will still "shoot for the stars".

title: One seaman survives capsize of cargo ship in typhoon
description: The Japanese coastguard rescued one seaman in a dramatic search operation in stormy seas.

title: Coronavirus: Can schools afford Covid costs?
description: Schools face a number of financial challenges as more pupils return to school full-time.

title: Coronavirus: The US has not reduced its Covid-19 death toll to 6% of total
description: False claims about the Covid-19 death toll in the US have gone viral. Here's why they're wrong.

title: The New Mutants: Director’s X-Men dream ‘cut in half by Hollywood reality’
description: Director Josh Boone on the long and "bumpy" journey to get The New Mutants to cinema screens.

title: 'I faced miscarriage alone - my partner had to wait in the car park'
description: Lockdown rules mean pregnant women must have scans alone - but what if there's bad news?
